label: 金青
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 55th  . Nara National Museum . 2003
説明文: A blue pigment derived from pulverizing basic copper(II)-carbonate. In the Nara period, dark blue azurite was called kinsei, while lighter shades were known as hakusei. Only a very small amount of azurite was mined in Japan; most was imported. Also iwagunjō, gunjō. [岩群青、群青]
